result.execSummary:
Christopher J Abendroth was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Christopher J Abendroth was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Abendroth

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Defendant has been turned over to the State of Minnesota on July 27, 2022.
On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court, defendant Christopher J Abendroth not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was served the Governor's Warrant in jail on 7/14/2022.   Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Minnesota.  Defense counsel informed the court that defendant is waiving extradition.  Milwaukee County Sheriff Valbona Ndina. 
Matter adjourned to ICCR for status date to confirm that defendant has been transported to the State of Minnesota.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
CID officert appeared and requested the status conference set on 7/15/2022 be amended to a hearing to allow the defendant to be produced to be served his Governor's warrant.     vk

Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court, defendant Christopher J Abendroth not in court, in custody, CJF.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has until 7.14.22 to serve the warrant.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher J Abendroth (appearing via Zoom video) with Attorney Christopher Scott Carson (appears in person).  Defendant Christopher J Abendroth in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears in person).
Discussion with the parties as to status of the extradition.
Defense counsel advises that they are requesting a governor's warrant.

Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Copy of Warrant from State of Minnesota, Ramsey County, St. Paul dated May 17, 2018

Defendant Christopher J Abendroth in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Christopher J Abendroth in custody.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher J Abendroth appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28 Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Minnesota. Defendant contested extradition. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
